content: I was wondering about something to do with Backdrop v2.0.0... It's a release where we can finally make breaking changes and 'fix' lots of stuff. But what happens if we forget to make a certain, breaking change for v2.0.0? If we release 2.0.0 without that change, then realise what we forgot to do, can we add it to 2.0.1, or is it still considered a breaking change and therefore has to wait until the next major version (3.0.0)?

The way I interpret it is:

  • if the change breaks things when moving from 1.x to 2.x then OK
  • if the change breaks things when moving from 2.x.y to 2.x.z then not OK and needs to wait till 3.x
What if both? :wink:
I also wonder when a 2.x branch will be created so we can start work on the plethora of new changes that need to be made...?
@BWPanda I don't think that we have any technical blockers on opening a 2.x branch. It will mean adding to the overhead of merging 1.x changes to more branches though.
I say we don't even attempt to work on 2.x until after Drupal 7 EOL. Simply because it gives us more focus as a community on ensuring that there's a smooth upgrade from d7

There's not much on the current list that excites me for 2.x https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/milestone/2

backdrop/backdrop-issues

Maybe some of them don't even need to wait for then. We've already made lots of progress on multilingual for instance
